Class MazeCell.CellState

  • java.lang.Object
    • MazeCell.CellState
  • Enclosing class:
    MazeCell

    public static final class MazeCell.CellState
extends java.lang.Object
    CellState is a class that represents the visitation state of a given cell. It is implemented to act like a primitive enum, but differs from a real enum in that it is essentially using a modified singleton pattern to ensure that only a couple of instances of this object ever exist. This means that serialized versions of this object will not transfer to another JVM without a bit of work. However, for the purposes of MazeRunner and most java code, this implementation is fine. This is put in the MazeCell as a nested (static) class because the CellState is arguably a property of MazeCells and only MazeCells.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static MazeCell.CellState notVisited
      The state when a cell has never been visited
      static MazeCell.CellState solutionPath
      The state when a cell is on the solution path (the path from the start to the donut)
      static MazeCell.CellState visited
      The state when a cell has been traversed fully.
      static MazeCell.CellState visitInProgress
      The state when a cell has been visited, but hasn't been fully processed (perhaps its calculating a heruristic, or its neighbors haven't been fully traversed yet when executing an algorithm like dfs)

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
